titre: Politics Briefing: Jason Kenney steps down as UCP leader after receiving 51-per-cent support in leadership review
texte_: Jason Kenney, the leader of the United Conservative Party (UCP) in Alberta, has stepped down after receiving 51-per-cent support in a leadership review. The review was conducted by the UCP’s board of directors and was the first of its kind since the party was formed in 2017. Kenney had been the leader of the UCP since its inception and had been widely expected to remain in the role. Kenney’s decision to step down comes after a tumultuous few months for the UCP. The party has been embroiled in a number of controversies, including allegations of interference in the nomination process for the upcoming provincial election. Kenney had been under increasing pressure from within the party to step down, with some members calling for a leadership review. The review was conducted by the UCP’s board of directors and was the first of its kind since the party was formed in 2017. Kenney had been widely expected to remain in the role, but the results of the review showed that he had only received 51-per-cent support from the board. This was seen as a sign that the party was divided on Kenney’s leadership and that it was time for a change. In a statement, Kenney said that he was “humbled and honoured” to have served as leader of the UCP and that he was “proud of the progress we have made in the past three years.” He also thanked the party’s members for their support and said that he was “confident that the UCP will continue to be a strong voice for Albertans.” Kenney’s departure from the UCP has left the party without a leader just months before the provincial election. The party is now in the process of selecting a new leader, with a leadership race expected to be held in the coming weeks. The UCP is currently the official opposition in Alberta and is expected to be a major player in the upcoming election. The party has been a vocal critic of the current NDP government and has promised to cut taxes and reduce government spending if elected. Kenney’s departure from the UCP has left the party without a leader just months before the provincial election. The party is now in the process of selecting a new leader, with a leadership race expected to be held in the coming weeks. The UCP is currently the official opposition in Alberta and is expected to be a major player in the upcoming election. The party has been a vocal critic of the current NDP government and has promised to cut taxes and reduce government spending if elected. The UCP’s new leader will have a difficult task ahead of them. They will need to unite the party and ensure that it is ready for the upcoming election. They will also need to address the controversies that have plagued the party in recent months and ensure that the UCP is seen as a credible alternative to the NDP. The UCP’s new leader will have a difficult task ahead of them. They will need to unite the party and ensure that it is ready for the upcoming election. They will also need to address the controversies that have plagued the party in recent months and ensure that the UCP is seen as a credible alternative to the NDP. The UCP’s new leader will have to work quickly to ensure that the party is ready for the election. With Kenney’s departure, the party is now in uncharted territory and the new leader will have to work hard to ensure that the UCP is seen as a viable option for Albertans.

titre: Marc Garneau on enjoying political life after cabinet ouster, writing his memoirs
texte_: Marc Garneau, the former Canadian Minister of Transport, is enjoying his post-cabinet life. After being ousted from the Trudeau cabinet in August, Garneau has been busy writing his memoirs and reflecting on his political career. Garneau, who was first elected to the House of Commons in 2008, has had a long and distinguished career in politics. He was the first Canadian in space, and served as the president of the Canadian Space Agency from 2001 to 2006. He was also the first Canadian to command a space shuttle mission. Garneau was appointed to the Trudeau cabinet in 2015, and served as the Minister of Transport until his ouster in August. During his time in cabinet, Garneau was responsible for overseeing the implementation of the Canada Transportation Act, which was passed in June 2016. He also oversaw the implementation of the Canada Infrastructure Bank, which was created to help fund infrastructure projects across the country. Garneau has said that he is enjoying his post-cabinet life, and is looking forward to the next chapter of his life. He is currently writing his memoirs, which will be released in the near future. Garneau has also been active in the political sphere since his ouster. He has been vocal in his criticism of the Trudeau government's handling of the Trans Mountain Pipeline expansion project, and has called for the government to take a more proactive approach to the project. Garneau has also been vocal in his support for the Liberal government's plan to legalize recreational marijuana. He has said that the government should take a cautious approach to the legalization of marijuana, and that it should be done in a way that is safe and responsible. Garneau has also been vocal in his support for the Liberal government's plan to legalize assisted dying. He has said that the government should take a compassionate approach to the issue, and that it should be done in a way that respects the wishes of those who are suffering. Garneau has also been vocal in his support for the Liberal government's plan to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. He has said that the government should take a proactive approach to reducing emissions, and that it should be done in a way that is both economically and environmentally responsible. Garneau has said that he is looking forward to the next chapter of his life, and that he is excited to see what the future holds. He is currently writing his memoirs, which will be released in the near future. He is also looking forward to spending more time with his family, and to continuing to be involved in the political sphere.

titre: Politics Briefing: Conservative leadership candidates to face off in French-language debate
texte_: The Conservative Party of Canada is preparing for a French-language debate between its leadership candidates. The debate will be held on April 10th and will be broadcast live on CPAC. The debate will be moderated by journalist and political commentator Jean-François Lisée. titre: Politics Briefing: Canadian Armed Forces has failed to stamp out sexual misconduct: Arbour
texte_: The Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) has failed to stamp out sexual misconduct, according to former Supreme Court Justice Louise Arbour. In a report released on Tuesday, Arbour said that the CAF has not done enough to address the issue of sexual misconduct in the military. The report, commissioned by the federal government, found that the CAF has not taken sufficient steps to prevent and address sexual misconduct, and that the military justice system is not adequately addressing the issue. The report also found that the CAF has not done enough to support victims of sexual misconduct, and that the military justice system is not adequately addressing the issue. Arbour said that the CAF needs to take a “zero tolerance” approach to sexual misconduct, and that the military justice system needs to be reformed to ensure that victims are supported and perpetrators are held accountable. titre: Virtual work reportedly the cause of tinnitus and other health problems for parliamentary interpreters
texte_: Parliamentary interpreters in Canada are facing a growing health crisis due to the increased use of virtual work. The interpreters, who are responsible for translating parliamentary proceedings into both official languages, are reporting an increase in tinnitus and other health problems due to the long hours of virtual work. The interpreters, who are employed by the House of Commons, have been working virtually since the pandemic began in March 2020. The interpreters are required to wear headphones for long periods of time, which can cause hearing damage and tinnitus. The interpreters also report feeling fatigued and stressed due to the long hours of virtual work. The interpreters are calling on the House of Commons to take action to protect their health. They are asking for better ergonomic equipment, such as adjustable chairs and headsets, as well as more breaks during virtual sessions. They are also asking for more support from the House of Commons in terms of mental health services and access to medical professionals. The interpreters are also calling for more flexibility in their work schedules. They are asking for more flexibility in terms of when they can work, as well as the ability to take breaks during virtual sessions. They are also asking for more support from the House of Commons in terms of mental health services and access to medical professionals. The interpreters are also asking for better compensation for their work. They are asking for a raise in their salaries, as well as better benefits and vacation time. The House of Commons has yet to respond to the interpreters’ demands. However, the House of Commons has recently announced that it is looking into the issue and is working on a plan to address the health concerns of the interpreters. The interpreters’ plight is a reminder of the importance of taking care of the health and safety of workers in the virtual workplace. As more and more people are working virtually, it is essential that employers take steps to ensure that their employees are safe and healthy. The interpreters’ demands are a reminder that virtual work can have serious health consequences if not properly managed.

titre: Politics Briefing: Conservative Party says it has 678,708 members, record for Canadian political party
texte_: The Conservative Party of Canada has announced that it has reached a record-breaking 678,708 members, making it the largest political party in the country. The news was announced by the party’s leader, Andrew Scheer, who said that the milestone was a testament to the party’s commitment to engaging Canadians in the political process. “This is a tremendous achievement for our party and a testament to the hard work of our members and volunteers,” said Scheer. “We are proud to be the largest political party in Canada and we will continue to work hard to ensure that our members’ voices are heard in Ottawa.” The Conservative Party’s membership numbers have been steadily increasing since the 2015 federal election, when the party had just over 300,000 members. Since then, the party has seen a surge in membership, with the number of members more than doubling in the past four years. The party’s growth has been attributed to a number of factors, including its focus on grassroots engagement and its commitment to engaging Canadians in the political process. The party has also been successful in recruiting new members through its online platform, which allows Canadians to join the party and participate in its activities. The Conservative Party’s record-breaking membership numbers come at a time when the party is preparing for the upcoming federal election. The party is hoping that its large membership base will help it to gain an edge over its opponents in the upcoming election. The Conservative Party’s record-breaking membership numbers are a testament to the party’s commitment to engaging Canadians in the political process. The party’s success in recruiting new members is a sign that Canadians are increasingly interested in participating in the political process and that the party is well-positioned to capitalize on this interest. The Conservative Party’s record-breaking membership numbers are also a sign that the party is well-positioned to make gains in the upcoming federal election. The party’s large membership base will give it an advantage in terms of fundraising and grassroots engagement, which could prove to be a decisive factor in the upcoming election.

titre: Politics Briefing: Ottawa to use regulation to ban handgun imports in two weeks
texte_: The federal government is set to introduce new regulations to ban the importation of handguns into Canada in two weeks. The move comes as part of the government's efforts to tackle gun violence in the country. The regulations will be introduced in the coming weeks and will be in effect immediately. The regulations will apply to all handguns imported into Canada, including those imported for recreational use. The government is also looking at ways to restrict the sale of handguns within Canada. The move is part of a broader effort by the government to address gun violence in Canada. The government has already taken steps to strengthen background checks for gun purchases, and has introduced legislation to ban certain types of military-style assault weapons. The government has also announced plans to invest $214 million over five years to support community-based initiatives to reduce gun violence. This includes funding for programs to help young people stay away from guns, as well as initiatives to help victims of gun violence. The government has also announced plans to create a new firearms advisory committee, which will provide advice on how to reduce gun violence in Canada. The committee will be made up of experts from a variety of backgrounds, including law enforcement, public health, and community organizations. The government's move to ban the importation of handguns is seen as a positive step in the fight against gun violence. However, some critics have argued that the regulations will not be effective in reducing gun violence, as criminals will still be able to access guns through the black market. The government has also faced criticism for not doing enough to address the root causes of gun violence, such as poverty and mental health issues. Critics have argued that the government should focus on addressing these issues, rather than simply banning handguns. The government's move to ban the importation of handguns is seen as a positive step in the fight against gun violence. However, it remains to be seen whether the regulations will be effective in reducing gun violence in Canada.

titre: Politics Briefing: Ottawa says it’s reviewing security protocols for cabinet ministers after harassment of Chrystia Freeland
texte_: The federal government is reviewing security protocols for cabinet ministers after a recent incident involving Foreign Affairs Minister Chrystia Freeland. Freeland was harassed by a group of protesters while attending a public event in Toronto last week. The protesters were reportedly shouting insults and obscenities at Freeland, and some even attempted to block her path. The incident has sparked a debate about the safety of cabinet ministers and the need for better security protocols. Public Safety Minister Bill Blair said the government is taking the incident seriously and is reviewing security protocols for cabinet ministers. “We take the safety of our cabinet ministers very seriously,” Blair said. “We are reviewing our security protocols to ensure that our cabinet ministers are safe and secure when they are out in public.” Blair said the government is also looking into the incident to determine if any laws were broken. “We are looking into the incident to determine if any laws were broken and if any action needs to be taken,” he said. The incident has also raised questions about the safety of other public figures, including politicians, journalists, and activists. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the government is committed to ensuring the safety of all Canadians, regardless of their political views. “We must ensure that all Canadians, regardless of their political views, can express themselves without fear of harassment or intimidation,” Trudeau said. The incident has also sparked a debate about the need for better security protocols for public figures. The federal government has already taken steps to improve security for cabinet ministers, including providing them with bodyguards and increasing their security detail when they are travelling. The government is also looking into providing additional security measures for other public figures, such as journalists and activists. The incident has also raised questions about the need for better security protocols for public events. titre: Politics Briefing: PM blames ‘pressure’ in society for threats to politicians
texte_: The Prime Minister of Canada, Justin Trudeau, has recently spoken out about the threats and intimidation that politicians face in society. In a recent interview, Trudeau said that the pressure of society is to blame for the threats that politicians face. Trudeau said that the pressure of society is a major factor in the threats that politicians face. titre: Politics Briefing: Indigenous teen and water activist Autumn Peltier says Trudeau must do more toward reconciliation
texte_: Autumn Peltier, a 15-year-old Indigenous water activist from Wikwemikong First Nation, is calling on Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to do more to advance reconciliation with Indigenous peoples. Peltier, who has been advocating for clean water since she was 8 years old, has been a vocal critic of the Trudeau government’s approach to Indigenous issues. She has spoken out against the government’s failure to implement the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP) and its lack of action on the 94 Calls to Action of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. At a recent press conference, Peltier said that Trudeau’s government has not done enough to address the issues facing Indigenous peoples. “We need to see real action,” she said. “We need to see the government taking concrete steps to address the systemic racism and discrimination that Indigenous peoples face.” Peltier has been a vocal advocate for Indigenous rights and has been a frequent presence at protests and rallies. She has also been a vocal critic of the Trudeau government’s handling of the Trans Mountain Pipeline expansion project, which she says will have a devastating impact on Indigenous communities. Peltier has also been a vocal advocate for the protection of Indigenous lands and waters. She has spoken out against the government’s failure to protect the rights of Indigenous peoples to their traditional lands and waters. Peltier has been a frequent presence at the United Nations, where she has spoken out against the government’s failure to implement UNDRIP. She has also been a vocal critic of the government’s failure to implement the recommendations of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Peltier’s activism has earned her recognition from around the world. She was recently named one of the BBC’s 100 Women of 2018 and was also named one of Canada’s Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25. Peltier’s message to Trudeau is clear: “We need to see real action. We need to see the government taking concrete steps to address the systemic racism and discrimination that Indigenous peoples face. We need to see the government implementing the recommendations of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission and the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples.” Peltier’s message is resonating with many Canadians, who are calling on the Trudeau government to do more to advance reconciliation with Indigenous peoples. The Trudeau government has taken some steps to address the issues facing Indigenous peoples, such as the creation of the National Inquiry into Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls and the introduction of the Indigenous Languages Act. However, many Indigenous activists and leaders say that much more needs to be done. The Trudeau government has also committed to implementing UNDRIP, but has yet to take concrete steps to do so. As Peltier and other Indigenous activists continue to call on the Trudeau government to do more to advance reconciliation, it remains to be seen whether the government will take meaningful action.

titre: Politics Briefing: Canada would need clear action plan before establishing Haiti mission, says PM
texte_: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said that Canada would need a clear action plan before establishing a mission in Haiti. The Prime Minister made the comments during a press conference on Tuesday, where he was asked about the possibility of Canada sending a mission to the Caribbean nation. Trudeau said that Canada has a long history of providing assistance to Haiti, and that the country is committed to helping the people of Haiti. However, he said that any mission would need to be carefully planned and executed. "We need to make sure that we have a clear action plan before we move forward with any mission," Trudeau said. "We need to make sure that we are doing the right thing for the people of Haiti, and that we are doing it in a way that is effective and sustainable." Trudeau also said that Canada would need to work closely with the Haitian government and other international partners to ensure that any mission is successful. "We need to make sure that we are working with the Haitian government and other international partners to ensure that any mission is successful," he said. "We need to make sure that we are doing the right thing for the people of Haiti, and that we are doing it in a way that is effective and sustainable." Trudeau also said that Canada would need to ensure that any mission is properly funded and resourced. "We need to make sure that we are providing the necessary resources and funding to ensure that any mission is successful," he said. "We need to make sure that we are doing the right thing for the people of Haiti, and that we are doing it in a way that is effective and sustainable." Trudeau's comments come as Canada is considering sending a mission to Haiti to help with the country's ongoing political and economic crisis. The mission would be part of a larger international effort to help the country stabilize and rebuild. The Prime Minister's comments suggest that Canada is taking a cautious approach to the situation in Haiti, and that any mission would need to be carefully planned and executed. It remains to be seen what form the mission will take, and how it will be funded and resourced. However, Trudeau's comments suggest that Canada is committed to helping the people of Haiti, and that any mission must be done in a way that is effective and sustainable.

titre: Politics Briefing: Trudeau concerned by requests for more federal health care money while provinces cut taxes
texte_: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is expressing concern over requests for more federal health care money while provinces are cutting taxes. The Prime Minister has been vocal in his support for a national pharmacare program, but he is now facing a dilemma as provinces are asking for more money for health care while simultaneously cutting taxes. The issue has been brought to the forefront in recent weeks as the federal government and provinces have been negotiating a new health accord. The provinces have been pushing for more money from the federal government to help fund health care, while at the same time, some provinces have been cutting taxes. The Prime Minister has said that he is “concerned” about the situation, and that he believes that the federal government should be investing in health care, not cutting taxes. “We need to make sure that we’re investing in health care, not cutting taxes,” Trudeau said in a recent interview. “We need to make sure that we’re investing in the services that Canadians need and deserve.” The Prime Minister has also said that he believes that the federal government should be investing in health care, not cutting taxes. titre: Politics Briefing: Alberta to take control of prosecutions for banned firearms from Ottawa, provincial justice minister says
texte_: Alberta's Justice Minister, Kaycee Madu, announced on Tuesday that the province will take control of prosecutions for banned firearms from the federal government. The move comes as part of the province's efforts to combat gun violence and illegal firearms trafficking. Madu said that the province will be able to better enforce the laws and regulations that are in place to protect Albertans. "We are taking action to ensure that those who possess, use, or traffic in illegal firearms are held accountable," Madu said. "We are taking control of prosecutions for banned firearms from the federal government and will be able to better enforce the laws and regulations that are in place to protect Albertans." Madu said that the province will be able to better target those who are illegally trafficking firearms and will be able to prosecute them more quickly and effectively. He also noted that the province will be able to better track and monitor firearms that are being used in criminal activities. The move is part of the province's efforts to combat gun violence and illegal firearms trafficking. The province has already implemented a number of measures to address the issue, including increasing the penalties for those who are found guilty of illegally trafficking firearms. The province has also implemented a number of initiatives to help reduce the number of firearms in circulation, including a buyback program and a firearms amnesty program. Madu said that the province is committed to ensuring that Albertans are safe and that those who are illegally trafficking firearms are held accountable. "We are taking action to ensure that those who possess, use, or traffic in illegal firearms are held accountable," Madu said. "We are taking control of prosecutions for banned firearms from the federal government and will be able to better enforce the laws and regulations that are in place to protect Albertans." The move has been welcomed by gun control advocates, who have long called for stronger measures to combat gun violence and illegal firearms trafficking. "This is an important step forward in the fight against gun violence and illegal firearms trafficking," said Wendy Cukier, president of the Coalition for Gun Control. "We are pleased to see the Alberta government taking action to ensure that those who possess, use, or traffic in illegal firearms are held accountable." The move has also been welcomed by the federal government, which has been pushing for stronger measures to combat gun violence and illegal firearms trafficking. "We are pleased to see the Alberta government taking action to ensure that those who possess, use, or traffic in illegal firearms are held accountable," said Bill Blair, Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness. "We are committed to working with the provinces and territories to ensure that we are doing everything we can to keep Canadians safe." The move is part of the province's efforts to combat gun violence and illegal firearms trafficking. The province has already implemented a number of measures to address the issue, including increasing the penalties for those who are found guilty of illegally trafficking firearms. The province has also implemented a number of initiatives to help reduce the number of firearms in circulation, including a buyback program and a firearms amnesty program. Madu said that the province is committed to ensuring that Albertans are safe and that those who are illegally trafficking firearms are held accountable. "We are taking action to ensure that those who possess, use, or traffic in illegal firearms are held accountable," Madu said. "We are taking control of prosecutions for banned firearms from the federal government and will be able to better enforce the laws and regulations that are in place to protect Albertans."

titre: Politics Briefing: Acadian group calls for leadership review of N.B. Premier Higgs over his bilingualism policies
texte_: A prominent Acadian group is calling for a leadership review of New Brunswick Premier Blaine Higgs over his bilingualism policies. The Acadian Federation of New Brunswick (AFNB) is demanding that the provincial government take action to ensure that the province’s official languages, English and French, are respected and protected. The AFNB is particularly concerned about the lack of progress on the implementation of the Official Languages Act, which was passed in 2002. The Act requires that all provincial government services be provided in both English and French. The AFNB is also concerned about the lack of progress on the implementation of the Official Languages Commissioner’s recommendations, which were released in 2018. The recommendations included the creation of a bilingualism strategy, the appointment of a bilingualism coordinator, and the establishment of a bilingualism fund. The AFNB is also concerned about the lack of progress on the implementation of the recommendations of the Commission on Official Languages, which was established in 2019. The Commission’s recommendations included the creation of a bilingualism strategy, the appointment of a bilingualism coordinator, and the establishment of a bilingualism fund. titre: Politics Briefing: Trudeau calls ArriveCan subcontracts through two-person firm ‘illogical,’ asks Privy Council Clerk to review
texte_: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has called the awarding of contracts to a two-person firm for the ArriveCan app “illogical” and has asked the Privy Council Clerk to review the situation. The ArriveCan app was created to help streamline the process of entering Canada for international travelers. The app was developed by a two-person firm, which was awarded the contract to manage the app. The awarding of the contract to the two-person firm has raised eyebrows in Ottawa, with some questioning the decision. Trudeau has now weighed in on the issue, calling the awarding of the contract “illogical” and asking the Privy Council Clerk to review the situation. The Prime Minister’s Office has said that Trudeau is “concerned” about the awarding of the contract and wants to ensure that the process was “fair and transparent.” The Privy Council Clerk is the head of the federal public service and is responsible for providing advice to the Prime Minister and Cabinet. The Clerk is also responsible for ensuring that the government’s procurement processes are fair and transparent. The awarding of the contract to the two-person firm has been criticized by some, who argue that the government should have gone through a competitive bidding process. The government has defended the decision, saying that the two-person firm was the most qualified to manage the app. The government has also said that the contract was awarded in accordance with the government’s procurement policies. The Privy Council Clerk is expected to review the awarding of the contract and provide advice to the Prime Minister and Cabinet. It is unclear how long the review will take, but it is expected to be completed in the coming weeks. The awarding of the contract to the two-person firm has raised questions about the government’s procurement process and has sparked a debate about how the government should award contracts. The Prime Minister’s Office has said that Trudeau is “committed to ensuring that the government’s procurement processes are fair and transparent.” The review by the Privy Council Clerk is expected to provide clarity on the issue and help ensure that the government’s procurement processes are fair and transparent.

titre: Politics Briefing: Advance look at health care proposal would have been helpful, Manitoba Premier says
texte_: Manitoba Premier Brian Pallister says he wishes he had been given an advance look at the federal government's health care proposal before it was released. The proposal, which was unveiled last week, includes a commitment to increase health care funding by $6 billion over the next five years. It also includes a plan to create a national pharmacare program and a national home care program. Pallister said he was disappointed that he wasn't given an advance look at the proposal, as he believes it would have been helpful in preparing his government for the changes. "We were not consulted on the proposal, and I think that's a mistake," Pallister said. "We should have been given an opportunity to provide input and feedback on the proposal before it was released." Pallister said he is concerned that the proposal does not address the needs of Manitobans, and that it could lead to a decrease in health care services in the province. "We need to make sure that the federal government is providing adequate funding to ensure that Manitobans have access to the health care services they need," Pallister said. Pallister said he is also concerned that the proposal does not address the issue of mental health care, which is an issue that is particularly important in Manitoba. "We need to make sure that the federal government is providing adequate funding to ensure that Manitobans have access to the mental health care services they need," Pallister said. Pallister said he is hopeful that the federal government will take his concerns into consideration and make changes to the proposal that will better meet the needs of Manitobans. "We need to make sure that the federal government is providing adequate funding to ensure that Manitobans have access to the health care services they need," Pallister said. "We need to make sure that the federal government is taking into account the unique needs of Manitobans when it comes to health care."

titre: Politics Briefing: Conservatives would maintain proposed federal health spending levels, Poilievre says
texte_: The Conservative Party of Canada is committed to maintaining the proposed federal health spending levels, according to the party’s finance critic, Pierre Poilievre. Speaking to reporters in Ottawa on Tuesday, Poilievre said that the Conservatives would not be making any changes to the proposed health spending levels, which were announced in the federal budget earlier this year. “We believe that the proposed health spending levels are appropriate and necessary to ensure that Canadians have access to the care they need,” Poilievre said. “We will not be making any changes to these levels.” The proposed health spending levels are part of the government’s plan to invest $6 billion over the next five years in health care. The money is intended to help fund new initiatives, such as mental health services, home care, and prescription drug coverage. The proposed health spending levels have been met with some criticism from opposition parties, who argue that the money should be used to address other pressing issues, such as poverty and housing. Poilievre, however, said that the Conservatives are committed to ensuring that Canadians have access to the care they need. “We believe that the proposed health spending levels are the right way to ensure that Canadians have access to the care they need,” he said. “We will not be making any changes to these levels.” Poilievre also noted that the Conservatives are committed to ensuring that the money is spent in a responsible and effective manner. “We will be monitoring the spending closely to ensure that it is being used in the most effective way possible,” he said. “We will also be working with the provinces and territories to ensure that the money is being used to its fullest potential.” The proposed health spending levels have been met with some criticism from opposition parties, who argue that the money should be used to address other pressing issues, such as poverty and housing. titre: Politics Briefing: Departing Ethics Commissioner says PM’s ethics issues have probably complicated efforts to encourage MPs to stick to the rules
texte_: The departure of Canada’s Ethics Commissioner, Mario Dion, has left many wondering what the future of ethics in Canadian politics will look like. Dion, who served as the Commissioner since 2017, was responsible for overseeing the ethical conduct of public office holders, including the Prime Minister. During his tenure, Dion found Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to have violated the Conflict of Interest Act on two separate occasions. The first violation occurred in 2018 when Trudeau accepted a vacation from the Aga Khan, a registered lobbyist. The second violation occurred in 2019 when Trudeau attempted to influence the former Attorney General in the SNC-Lavalin affair. In his final report, Dion said that Trudeau’s ethical issues have likely complicated efforts to encourage MPs to stick to the rules. He noted that the Prime Minister’s actions have “undermined public confidence in the integrity of the office of the Prime Minister” and “created a perception that the rules do not apply to the Prime Minister.” Dion’s departure has raised questions about the future of ethics in Canadian politics. The Trudeau government has yet to name a replacement for Dion, and it is unclear who will take on the role. The government has also yet to address the issues raised by Dion in his final report. Trudeau has said that he takes “full responsibility” for his actions, but has not provided any concrete steps to address the issues. The lack of action has been met with criticism from opposition parties, who have accused the government of not taking ethics seriously. NDP leader Jagmeet Singh has called on the government to “take real action to restore public trust in our democracy.” The Trudeau government has also been criticized for its handling of the SNC-Lavalin affair. The scandal has raised questions about the government’s commitment to transparency and accountability. The departure of Dion has also raised questions about the future of ethics in Canadian politics. It remains to be seen who will take on the role of Ethics Commissioner and how the government will address the issues raised by Dion in his final report. In the meantime, the Trudeau government must take steps to restore public trust in the office of the Prime Minister and ensure that all public office holders are held to the highest ethical standards. Without action, the government risks further eroding public confidence in the integrity of the office of the Prime Minister and the ethical conduct of public office holders.

titre: Edward Norton’s Motherless Brooklyn is a genre orphan in need of urgent cinematic foster care
texte_: I’m sure that the actor and director Edward Norton is often the smartest person in the room. But thi [...] | Norton’s film adaptation of Motherless Brooklyn is a genre orphan in need of urgent cinematic foster care. It’s a film that’s hard to categorize, and it’s a shame that it’s been so long in the making. Norton’s script is a mix of noir, mystery, and drama, but it’s not quite any of those genres. It’s a film that’s hard to pin down, and it’s a shame that it’s been so long in the making. The film follows Lionel Essrog (Norton), a private investigator with Tourette syndrome, as he investigates the death of his mentor, Frank Minna (Bruce Willis). titre: Review: The Miseducation of Cameron Post captures the fugue state that is adolescence
texte_: The Miseducation of Cameron Post is a coming-of-age drama that captures the confusion and uncertainty of adolescence. Directed by Desiree Akhavan, the film follows Cameron Post (Chloë Grace Moretz) as she navigates her teenage years in rural Montana. After being caught in a compromising situation with another girl, Cameron is sent to a Christian conversion therapy camp. The film is a powerful exploration of identity and self-acceptance. Akhavan’s direction is subtle and nuanced, allowing the audience to experience the story through Cameron’s eyes. Moretz’s performance is captivating and heartbreaking, as she conveys the confusion and fear of a young person struggling to find her place in the world. The film’s supporting cast is equally impressive. Sasha Lane and Forrest Goodluck bring a unique energy to their roles as Cameron’s friends, Jane and Adam. John Gallagher Jr. is also excellent as the camp’s leader, Reverend Rick. His performance is both menacing and sympathetic, as he struggles to reconcile his own faith with the camp’s mission. The Miseducation of Cameron Post is a thoughtful and moving exploration of identity and self-acceptance. Akhavan’s direction is masterful, and the performances are all excellent. The film captures the confusion and uncertainty of adolescence, and is a powerful reminder that everyone deserves to be accepted for who they are.

titre: Review: The Reckoning: Hollywood’s Worst-Kept Secret casts a wide net in the post-Weinstein era
texte_: The Reckoning: Hollywood’s Worst-Kept Secret is a powerful documentary that casts a wide net in the post-Weinstein era. Directed by Emmy-winning filmmaker Amy Ziering, the film takes a deep dive into the systemic issues of sexual harassment and abuse in the entertainment industry. The documentary follows the stories of several women who have experienced sexual harassment and abuse in Hollywood, including actresses Ashley Judd and Rose McGowan. Through their stories, the film paints a vivid picture of the power dynamics that have enabled the abuse to continue for so long. It also examines the ways in which the industry has failed to protect its workers, and how the culture of silence has allowed perpetrators to remain in power. The film is an unflinching look at the realities of sexual harassment and abuse in Hollywood, and it is a must-watch for anyone interested in the issue. Ziering’s direction is masterful, and she does an excellent job of weaving together the stories of the women featured in the film. The interviews are powerful and heartbreaking, and the film does an excellent job of highlighting the systemic issues that have enabled the abuse to continue. The Reckoning also features interviews with industry insiders, including actors, directors, and producers, who discuss the ways in which the industry has failed to protect its workers. These interviews provide an important perspective on the issue, and they help to illustrate the ways in which the industry has enabled the abuse to continue. The Reckoning is an important film that sheds light on the systemic issues of sexual harassment and abuse in Hollywood. It is a must-watch for anyone interested in the issue, and it is a powerful reminder of the need for change in the industry. Ziering’s direction is masterful, and the film is an unflinching look at the realities of sexual harassment and abuse in Hollywood. It is a powerful and heartbreaking documentary that casts a wide net in the post-Weinstein era, and it is a must-watch for anyone interested in the issue.

titre: Review: The Wild Pear Tree grows slowly, but comes alive as the roots take hold
texte_: The Wild Pear Tree is a film that slowly grows on you as the story takes hold. It follows Sinan, a young man who returns to his small hometown in Turkey after graduating from university. He is determined to make a name for himself as a writer, but his dreams are quickly dashed when he finds out that his father has accumulated a large debt. Sinan is forced to take a job as a teacher, and he struggles to make ends meet while trying to write his novel. The film is a slow burn, but it is worth the wait. Director Nuri Bilge Ceylan has crafted a beautiful and thoughtful story that is both heartbreaking and uplifting. The cinematography is stunning, capturing the beauty of the Turkish countryside and the small town life. The performances are all excellent, particularly from Aydin Doğu Demirkol as Sinan. He brings a quiet intensity to the role, and his performance is a highlight of the film. The Wild Pear Tree is a film about dreams and the struggle to make them come true. It is a story of hope and resilience, and it is a reminder that sometimes the best things in life take time to grow. The film is a slow burn, but it is worth the wait. It is a beautiful and thoughtful story that will stay with you long after the credits roll.

titre: Review: Tantoo Cardinal’s long-delayed starring role is one of Falls Around Her’s strengths
texte_: Tantoo Cardinal has been a fixture in Canadian cinema for decades, but her starring role in Falls Around Her has been a long time coming. The film, written and directed by Darlene Naponse, follows Mary Birchbark (Cardinal), a renowned Anishinaabe musician who returns to her home community in Northern Ontario after a long absence. The film is a quiet, contemplative piece that takes its time to explore the complexities of Mary’s life. Cardinal’s performance is a masterclass in subtlety and nuance, as she conveys the weight of Mary’s past and present with a few simple gestures and glances. Her performance is the heart of the film, and it’s a testament to her talent that she can convey so much with so little. The film is also a showcase for the stunning beauty of Northern Ontario. Naponse’s direction captures the majesty of the landscape, from the rolling hills and lush forests to the shimmering lakes and rivers. The cinematography is breathtaking, and it’s a reminder of the beauty that can be found in Canada’s north. The film also features strong performances from the supporting cast, including Tantoo’s daughter, Cree Summer, as Mary’s daughter, and Kawennáhere Devery Jacobs as Mary’s niece. The two young actresses bring a warmth and energy to the film that helps to balance out the more somber moments. Falls Around Her is a thoughtful and moving film that is sure to resonate with viewers. It’s a reminder of the power of cinema to tell stories that are both personal and universal. It’s also a reminder of the importance of giving long-overdue recognition to the talent of actors like Tantoo Cardinal. titre: Harriet Tubman biopic never lets audiences truly discover the U.S. hero’s greatness
texte_: Harriet Tubman is an American hero whose legacy has been celebrated for generations. Her story of courage and resilience in the face of adversity has inspired countless people around the world. But the recent biopic about her life, Harriet, fails to capture the true greatness of this remarkable woman. The film follows Tubman’s life from her childhood in Maryland to her escape from slavery and her subsequent work as a conductor on the Underground Railroad. While the film does a good job of depicting Tubman’s courage and determination, it fails to capture the full scope of her greatness. The film focuses heavily on Tubman’s escape from slavery and her work on the Underground Railroad, but it fails to explore her other accomplishments. Tubman was a leader in the abolitionist movement, a nurse during the Civil War, and a suffragist. She was also a passionate advocate for the rights of African Americans and women. The film also fails to explore Tubman’s spiritual life. Tubman was a deeply religious woman who believed that God was guiding her on her journey. She was a devout Christian who believed that her faith was a source of strength and courage. The film also fails to explore Tubman’s legacy. Tubman’s story has inspired countless people around the world, and her legacy continues to live on in the hearts and minds of many. Her story is a reminder of the power of courage and resilience in the face of adversity. Harriet is a well-made film that does a good job of depicting Tubman’s courage and determination. But it fails to capture the full scope of her greatness. Tubman was a leader, a nurse, a suffragist, and a passionate advocate for the rights of African Americans and women. She was also a deeply religious woman whose faith was a source of strength and courage. Her legacy continues to live on in the hearts and minds of many, and her story is a reminder of the power of courage and resilience in the face of adversity.

titre: Reed Morano’s direction elevates amateur-assassin thriller The Rhythm Section above its tangled plotting
texte_: Reed Morano’s direction in The Rhythm Section is a masterclass in how to elevate a film above its tangled plotting. The film follows Stephanie Patrick (Blake Lively), a woman who is out for revenge after her family is killed in a plane crash. She is trained by a former MI6 agent (Jude Law) to become an assassin and take down those responsible for the crash. Morano’s direction is a key factor in making The Rhythm Section a success. She brings a unique visual style to the film, creating a gritty and realistic atmosphere. The camera work is often handheld, giving the film a documentary-like feel. This helps to draw the audience into the story and make them feel as if they are part of the action. The film also benefits from Morano’s use of color. She uses a muted color palette to create a sense of dread and tension. This helps to build suspense and keep the audience on the edge of their seats. The use of color also helps to create a sense of realism, making the film feel more grounded and believable. Morano’s direction also helps to bring out the best in the performances. She is able to draw out strong performances from her cast, particularly from Blake Lively. Lively is able to bring a sense of vulnerability and strength to her character, making her a sympathetic and relatable protagonist. Jude Law also gives a strong performance as the MI6 agent, bringing a sense of gravitas to the role. The Rhythm Section is a thrilling and intense film, and Morano’s direction is a key factor in making it a success. She is able to elevate the film above its tangled plotting, creating a gritty and realistic atmosphere. Her use of color and camera work helps to draw the audience into the story and make them feel as if they are part of the action. Her direction also helps to bring out the best in the performances, making The Rhythm Section a thrilling and intense experience.

titre: The timely but incompetent Run This Town is as regrettable as Rob Ford’s many Toronto City Hall scandals
texte_: The release of the new movie Run This Town has been met with a mix of anticipation and trepidation. The film, which stars Ben Platt, Mena Massoud, and Nina Dobrev, follows the story of a young journalist who attempts to uncover a scandal involving a Toronto city councillor. The film has been met with criticism for its portrayal of Toronto and its citizens. Many have argued that the film paints a negative and inaccurate picture of the city, and that it fails to capture the diversity and vibrancy of the city. The film has also been criticized for its portrayal of Rob Ford, the former mayor of Toronto. Ford was embroiled in a number of scandals during his time in office, and the film fails to capture the complexity of his story. Instead, it paints him as a one-dimensional villain, which many have argued is an oversimplification of the situation. The film has also been criticized for its lack of accuracy. Many of the details of the story are inaccurate, and the film fails to capture the nuances of the situation. This has led to many viewers feeling that the film is not an accurate representation of the events that took place. The film has also been criticized for its lack of depth. The characters are shallow and one-dimensional, and the story fails to explore the complexities of the situation. This has led to many viewers feeling that the film is not a meaningful exploration of the events that took place. Overall, the film has been met with a mix of criticism and disappointment. While the film has some interesting elements, it fails to capture the complexity of the situation and the nuances of the characters. This has led to many viewers feeling that the film is not a meaningful exploration of the events that took place. As such, the film is a regrettable reminder of the many scandals that took place during Rob Ford’s time in office.

titre: It’s a Sin is a powerful postcard from the horrific heights of the AIDS crisis
texte_: It’s a Sin, the new five-part drama series from Russell T. Davies, is a powerful postcard from the horrific heights of the AIDS crisis. Set in the 1980s, the show follows a group of young friends as they navigate the joys and heartbreaks of life in London. The series is a powerful reminder of the devastating impact of the AIDS epidemic on the LGBTQ+ community. It’s a Sin is a heartbreaking and honest look at the struggles of those affected by the virus, and the prejudice and discrimination they faced. The show is a powerful exploration of the human cost of the AIDS crisis. It’s a Sin follows the lives of Ritchie (Olly Alexander), Roscoe (Omari Douglas), Colin (Callum Scott Howells), Ash (Nathaniel Curtis) and Jill (Lydia West) as they come of age in the shadow of the virus. The series is a powerful reminder of the courage and resilience of those affected by the AIDS crisis. The characters in It’s a Sin are determined to live their lives to the fullest, despite the fear and stigma surrounding the virus. The show is also a powerful exploration of the power of friendship. The characters in It’s a Sin are united by their shared experience of the AIDS crisis, and their friendship is a source of strength and comfort in the face of adversity. It’s a Sin is a powerful reminder of the importance of standing up for what is right. The characters in the show are determined to fight for justice and equality, and to challenge the prejudice and discrimination they face. It’s a Sin is a powerful and moving tribute to those affected by the AIDS crisis. The show is a powerful reminder of the courage and resilience of those affected by the virus, and of the importance of standing up for what is right. It’s a powerful postcard from the horrific heights of the AIDS crisis.

titre: David Oyelowo’s kid-friendly The Water Man does better with the realism than the magic, but that’s okay
texte_: David Oyelowo’s latest film, The Water Man, is a kid-friendly adventure that is sure to delight viewers of all ages. The film follows the story of a young boy, Gunner, who is determined to save his ailing mother by finding a mythical figure known as the Water Man. While the film does contain some magical elements, it is ultimately grounded in realism. The Water Man is set in a small town in Oregon, and the film does a great job of capturing the beauty of the Pacific Northwest. The scenery is lush and vibrant, and the film does a great job of conveying the sense of community that exists in small towns. The characters are all well-developed and the relationships between them are believable and engaging. The Water Man also does a great job of exploring the themes of family and friendship. Gunner’s relationship with his father is particularly poignant, as the two struggle to come to terms with the fact that his mother is ill. The film also touches on the importance of believing in yourself and never giving up on your dreams. The Water Man does contain some magical elements, but they are used sparingly and are never over-the-top. The magical elements are used to enhance the story, rather than to distract from it. The film also does a great job of blending the magical elements with the realism of the story. The Water Man is a great example of a kid-friendly film that is both entertaining and thought-provoking. The film does a great job of exploring themes of family, friendship, and believing in yourself. The magical elements are used sparingly and are never over-the-top. The film is also visually stunning, with lush scenery and vibrant characters. The Water Man is sure to delight viewers of all ages.

titre: Dear Evan Hansen wants to shore up the lonely and spread the gospel of tolerance
texte_: Dear Evan Hansen is a musical that has taken the world by storm. It tells the story of a high school student who struggles with social anxiety and depression. The show has resonated with audiences around the world, and has become a symbol of hope and understanding for those who feel alone and misunderstood. The show’s message of acceptance and understanding has been embraced by many, and its themes of loneliness and tolerance have been embraced by those who have seen it. The show’s creator, Steven Levenson, has said that he wanted to create a show that would “shore up the lonely” and spread the gospel of tolerance. The show has been praised for its honest and heartfelt portrayal of mental health issues, and its ability to make audiences feel seen and heard. It has been praised for its ability to make people feel less alone, and for its message of hope and understanding. The show has also been praised for its use of music to convey its message. The show’s music has been described as “uplifting” and “empowering”, and has been praised for its ability to make people feel connected and understood. The show’s music has been described as “a balm for the soul”, and has been credited with helping people to cope with their struggles. The show has also been praised for its ability to bring people together. It has been credited with helping to bridge divides between different groups of people, and for its ability to foster understanding and acceptance. The show has been praised for its ability to bring people together, and for its message of hope and understanding. The show has also been praised for its ability to inspire people to take action. It has been credited with inspiring people to speak out against injustice, and to stand up for what is right. The show has been praised for its ability to inspire people to take action, and for its message of hope and understanding. Dear Evan Hansen has become a symbol of hope and understanding for those who feel alone and misunderstood. It has been praised for its honest and heartfelt portrayal of mental health issues, its use of music to convey its message, its ability to bring people together, and its ability to inspire people to take action. titre: Michael Schur’s new book tackles so-called cancel culture, and offers guidance on how to navigate it
texte_: In recent years, the concept of “cancel culture” has become a hot-button issue. It’s a term used to describe the practice of boycotting or ostracizing someone for their views or actions, often in the form of public shaming. It’s a phenomenon that has been widely discussed in the media, and now, Michael Schur, the creator of the hit TV show The Good Place, has weighed in with his new book, “Cancel Culture: How to Navigate It.” Schur’s book is an exploration of the concept of cancel culture, and how it has become a part of our lives. He examines the history of cancel culture, from its roots in the civil rights movement to its current incarnation as a tool of social media. He also looks at the implications of cancel culture, and how it can be used to both positive and negative ends. Schur’s book is an important contribution to the conversation about cancel culture. He offers a thoughtful and nuanced look at the issue, and provides readers with a framework for understanding the complexities of the issue. He also offers practical advice on how to navigate cancel culture, and how to respond to it in a constructive way. Schur’s book is an important contribution to the conversation about cancel culture, and it’s a must-read for anyone interested in the topic. It’s an insightful and thought-provoking look at the issue, and it provides readers with a valuable perspective on how to approach it. titre: Ben Affleck, Ana de Armas erotic thriller Deep Water seductively whispers: Who thought this was a good idea?
texte_: The latest erotic thriller from Ben Affleck and Ana de Armas, Deep Water, is a seductive whisper that begs the question: Who thought this was a good idea? The film follows the story of a married couple, Vic and Melinda Van Allen, who have an open marriage. While Vic is away on business, Melinda begins to explore her sexuality with other men. As the story progresses, it becomes clear that Vic is not as accepting of the arrangement as he initially seemed. The film is a slow-burn thriller that builds tension as the couple's relationship unravels. Affleck and de Armas have a palpable chemistry that is both captivating and unsettling. Their performances are nuanced and layered, and they bring a sense of realism to the story. The film is visually stunning, with lush cinematography and a haunting score. The soundtrack is a mix of classical and modern music, which adds to the atmosphere of the film. The film is not without its flaws. The pacing is slow at times, and the story can be a bit predictable. However, the performances of Affleck and de Armas are strong enough to carry the film. Deep Water is a seductive whisper that begs the question: Who thought this was a good idea? It is a film that is both captivating and unsettling, and it is sure to leave viewers with plenty to think about. It is a film that is sure to stay with viewers long after the credits roll.

titre: Keira Knightley’s first foray into animation tells the story of Jewish painter Charlotte Salomon
texte_: Keira Knightley is no stranger to the world of acting, having starred in a number of critically acclaimed films such as Pride and Prejudice, The Imitation Game, and Atonement. Now, the British actress is taking her talents to the world of animation with her first foray into the genre, the upcoming film Charlotte’s Song. The film tells the story of Charlotte Salomon, a Jewish painter who lived in Germany during the 1930s and 1940s. Salomon was a prolific artist, creating over 1,300 paintings during her lifetime. Her work was largely autobiographical, and she often used her art to express her feelings about the political and social climate of the time. The film follows Salomon’s life from her childhood in Berlin to her eventual escape to the south of France. Along the way, she faces a number of obstacles, including the rise of the Nazi party and the persecution of Jews. Despite these challenges, Salomon perseveres and continues to create her art. Knightley’s performance as Salomon is sure to be a highlight of the film. The actress has a long history of playing strong female characters, and her portrayal of Salomon is sure to be no exception. She brings a sense of strength and resilience to the role, and her performance is sure to be a powerful one. The film also features a number of other talented actors, including Rupert Friend, Tom Wilkinson, and Emily Watson. The cast is rounded out by a number of talented voice actors, including David Tennant, who voices Salomon’s father. Charlotte’s Song is sure to be an emotional and powerful film. It tells the story of a woman who faced incredible adversity and yet still managed to create beautiful art. It is a testament to the power of the human spirit, and a reminder of the importance of standing up for what is right. Keira Knightley’s first foray into animation is sure to be a memorable one. Her performance as Charlotte Salomon is sure to be a powerful one, and the film is sure to be an emotional and inspiring one. Charlotte’s Song is sure to be a must-see for fans of animation and those who appreciate a good story.

titre: Is God Is star Oyin Oladejo had to learn to ‘de-role’ with character that hits close to home
texte_: Oyin Oladejo is a rising star in the entertainment industry. She has been featured in a number of films and television shows, and her latest role in the critically acclaimed film Is God Is has been garnering her a lot of attention. In the film, Oladejo plays a character that is very close to her own life. The film follows the story of two sisters, Racine and Ana, who are on a mission to avenge their mother’s death. Oladejo plays Racine, a young woman who is struggling to come to terms with her mother’s death and her own identity. Oladejo has said that the role was particularly challenging for her because it was so close to her own life. “It was a really intense experience for me,” Oladejo said. “I had to learn to de-role with this character because it was so close to home. I had to really dig deep and find the strength to portray this character in a way that was true to her and true to me.” Oladejo’s performance in Is God Is has been praised by critics and audiences alike. She has been praised for her ability to bring a sense of realism to the character, and for her ability to convey the emotions of the character in a powerful and moving way. Oladejo’s performance in Is God Is is a testament to her talent and her dedication to her craft. She has said that she is grateful for the opportunity to play such a complex and emotionally charged role, and that it has been a learning experience for her. “I’m so grateful for the opportunity to play this role,” Oladejo said. “It has been a learning experience for me, and I’m so proud of the work I’ve done. I’m so thankful for the support I’ve received from the cast and crew, and I’m so excited to see what the future holds.” Oyin Oladejo is a rising star in the entertainment industry, and her performance in Is God Is is a testament to her talent and her dedication to her craft. She has shown that she is capable of taking on challenging roles and delivering powerful performances. With her star on the rise, it will be exciting to see what she does next.

titre: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris star Lesley Manville wants to play light and bright, for a change
texte_: Lesley Manville is an English actress who has been in the business for over four decades. She has been in a variety of films, television shows, and stage productions, but her latest role in Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is one of her most memorable. Manville plays the titular character, Mrs. Harris, a widow who decides to take a trip to Paris to fulfill her lifelong dream of seeing the city. She is accompanied by her daughter, played by Lily James, and the two embark on a journey of self-discovery and exploration. Manville has been praised for her performance in the film, and she has said that she was drawn to the role because of the lightness and brightness of the character. She wanted to play a character who was not weighed down by the darkness of her past, but instead was able to find joy and happiness in the present. Manville has said that she was inspired by the character of Mrs. Harris because she was able to find joy in the small moments of life. She was able to appreciate the beauty of the city and the people she encountered, and she was able to find joy in the simple things. Manville has said that she was also drawn to the role because of the opportunity to work with director Stephen Frears. She has said that Frears is a master at creating characters that are both complex and relatable, and she was excited to work with him on this project. Manville has said that she hopes that her performance in Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris will inspire others to find joy in the small moments of life. She believes that it is important to take time to appreciate the beauty of the world around us, and to find joy in the simple things. Manville has said that she is looking forward to her next project, which she hopes will be a bit lighter and brighter than her previous roles. She is excited to explore new characters and stories, and to continue to bring joy to audiences around the world.

titre: ‘As of next week, I’m going to be in sweatpants’: Sarah Polley on the roller-coaster ride of Oscar season
texte_: As the Academy Awards approach, the stars of Hollywood are in the midst of a roller-coaster ride of press junkets, red carpets, and interviews. For Sarah Polley, the Canadian actress and director, the experience has been a whirlwind of emotions. Polley, who is nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay for her film “Stories We Tell”, has been on the road for the past few weeks, attending screenings and events in support of her film. She’s been to Los Angeles, New York, and Toronto, and has been interviewed by countless media outlets. “It’s been a really intense experience,” Polley says. “It’s been a lot of fun, but it’s also been really overwhelming.” Polley says that the experience has been both exciting and exhausting. She’s been able to meet some of her idols, and has been able to share her story with the world. But the constant travel and media attention has taken its toll. “I’m looking forward to getting back home and just being able to relax,” she says. “As of next week, I’m going to be in sweatpants.” Polley says that the experience has been a learning one. She’s been able to see how the industry works, and has been able to meet some of the most influential people in the business. “It’s been really eye-opening,” she says. “I’ve been able to see how the industry works, and how the awards season works. It’s been a great experience.” Polley says that she’s been able to take away some valuable lessons from the experience. She’s learned to be more confident in her work, and to trust her instincts. She’s also learned to be more patient and to take things one step at a time. “It’s been a great experience,” she says. “I’ve learned a lot, and I’m really grateful for the opportunity.” Polley says that she’s looking forward to the Academy Awards, but she’s also looking forward to getting back to her normal life. She’s looking forward to spending time with her family and friends, and to getting back to her creative projects. “I’m really looking forward to getting back to my life,” she says. “I’m looking forward to getting back to my work, and to being able to just relax and enjoy life.” For Polley, the experience of Oscar season has been a roller-coaster ride of emotions. But she’s come away from it with a newfound appreciation for the industry, and for the people who make it all possible. “It’s been an incredible experience,” she says. “I’m so grateful for the opportunity, and I’m looking forward to getting back to my life.”

titre: Engine 'surge' said to be behind Air Canada jet's emergency landing in Toronto
texte_: An Air Canada jet was forced to make an emergency landing in Toronto on Tuesday after experiencing a "surge" in its engine, according to the airline. The Airbus A320 was en route from Montreal to Toronto when the incident occurred. The plane was carrying 132 passengers and five crew members. The airline said the plane's pilots noticed a "surge" in the engine and decided to make an emergency landing. The plane landed safely at Toronto's Pearson International Airport and all passengers and crew were unharmed. The incident has raised questions about the safety of air travel in Quebec, particularly in light of recent reports of engine failures on other Air Canada flights. In April, an Air Canada flight from Montreal to Toronto was forced to make an emergency landing after experiencing engine failure. The plane was carrying more than 100 passengers and crew members. In June, another Air Canada flight from Montreal to Toronto was forced to make an emergency landing after experiencing engine failure. The plane was carrying more than 150 passengers and crew members. The incidents have prompted the Quebec government to launch an investigation into the safety of air travel in the province. The investigation will look into the causes of the engine failures and the safety measures taken by Air Canada. The investigation is expected to take several months to complete. In the meantime, the Quebec government has urged Air Canada to take all necessary steps to ensure the safety of its passengers and crew. The airline has said it is taking the incidents seriously and is working with the Quebec government to ensure the safety of its passengers and crew. The incident has also raised questions about the safety of air travel in Canada. titre: Quebec couple’s deaths, which left boy stranded in house, were caused by fentanyl
texte_: A Quebec couple’s deaths, which left their young son stranded in their home, were caused by fentanyl, according to a coroner’s report released this week. The report, which was released on Tuesday, revealed that the couple, who were in their late thirties, died of an accidental overdose of fentanyl. The couple’s son, who was only seven years old at the time, was found alone in the house after their deaths. The couple had been living in a small town in the Eastern Townships of Quebec. They had been struggling with addiction for some time, and had been using fentanyl for several months prior to their deaths. The coroner’s report noted that the couple had been using fentanyl for recreational purposes, and that they had not been prescribed the drug by a doctor. The report also noted that the couple had been using the drug in a “risky manner”, and that they had not been taking the necessary precautions to ensure their safety. The report concluded that the couple’s deaths were a “tragic and preventable” result of their drug use. It also noted that the couple’s son had been left alone in the house after their deaths, and that he had been “traumatized” by the experience. The report recommended that the provincial government take steps to address the issue of fentanyl use in Quebec, and to ensure that those who are using the drug are doing so in a safe and responsible manner. The report also recommended that the provincial government provide more resources to help those struggling with addiction, and to ensure that those who are using drugs are provided with the necessary support and treatment. The report’s findings have been met with shock and sadness by the couple’s family and friends, who are now struggling to come to terms with the tragedy. The couple’s death is a stark reminder of the dangers of fentanyl use, and the need for greater awareness and education about the drug. It is also a reminder of the importance of providing support and resources to those who are struggling with addiction, and of the need to ensure that those who are using drugs are doing so in a safe and responsible manner.

titre: Toronto police chief seeks review of force’s handling of missing people investigations
texte_: Toronto Police Chief Mark Saunders has called for a review of the force's handling of missing people investigations, citing a need to ensure that all cases are being handled properly. The call for a review comes after a series of high-profile cases in which the Toronto Police Service (TPS) has been criticized for its handling of missing persons investigations. In particular, the TPS has been criticized for its handling of the cases of Tess Richey and Alloura Wells, two transgender women who went missing in 2017 and whose bodies were found months later. The review will be conducted by an independent third-party and will focus on the TPS's policies and procedures for missing persons investigations. It will also examine the TPS's response to missing persons cases, including how it communicates with families and the public. Chief Saunders said the review is necessary to ensure that the TPS is doing everything it can to ensure that missing persons cases are handled properly. He said the review will help the TPS identify any areas where it can improve its response to missing persons cases. "We want to make sure that we are doing everything we can to ensure that we are doing our best to investigate these cases," Chief Saunders said. "We want to make sure that we are doing everything we can to ensure that we are doing our best to investigate these cases and that we are doing our best to support the families of those who are missing." The review is expected to take several months to complete and will include input from families of missing persons, community members, and experts in the field. The results of the review will be made public when it is completed. The review comes as the TPS is facing increased scrutiny over its handling of missing persons cases. In Quebec, the provincial government has launched an inquiry into the death of Joyce Echaquan, an Indigenous woman who died in a Quebec hospital after being subjected to racist comments by hospital staff. The inquiry is expected to examine the role of police in responding to cases of missing and murdered Indigenous women and girls. It is also expected to look at the role of police in responding to cases of missing persons in general. The review of the TPS's handling of missing persons investigations is an important step in ensuring that all cases are handled properly and that families of missing persons are supported. It is also an important step in ensuring that the TPS is doing everything it can to ensure that missing persons cases are investigated thoroughly and that families are kept informed.

titre: Alleged serial killer Bruce McArthur faces seventh charge of first-degree murder
texte_: Quebec politics has been rocked by the news that alleged serial killer Bruce McArthur has been charged with a seventh count of first-degree murder. McArthur, a 66-year-old landscaper from Toronto, was arrested in January 2018 and charged with six counts of first-degree murder in connection with the deaths of six men who had gone missing from Toronto's Gay Village. The latest charge, which was announced on Wednesday, is in connection with the death of Abdulbasir Faizi, a 42-year-old man who went missing in 2010. McArthur is now facing seven counts of first-degree murder in connection with the deaths of seven men. The news of the latest charge has sent shockwaves through the Quebec political community.
